meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>call</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to call</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to call out</vocabulary>. As in "HEY, YOU!"
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the kanji, so you should be good here. Just imagine yourself  calling out to someone: "<reading>YO</reading> (よ)! You!"
